page.title: 04Education in Nailsea
page.content: {Hannah More Infants School,}on the same site as Grove Junior School, was built in 1970. It was named after{Miss {Hannah More}who, with her sister, set up many small schools in this part of the country in the late 18th C., long before the 1870 Education Act which began "education for all children". Hannah More set up a Sunday school in Nailsea in 1791 near Holy Trinity Church. This later became the Nailsea Parochial School for children from 5 to 14 years and then, when the Grove and Hannah More Schools were built, it became the Annexe to the over-flowing Grove Junior School until 1984. Now that old building is used by Social Services as a day centre for handicapped people. Hannah More's first pupils were children of 5 to 12 years who worked in the local coalmines and glassworks.
